citation.article-title: Verrucosispora lutea sp. nov., isolated from a mangrove sediment sample
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Verrucosispora lutea sp. nov.
Verrucosispora lutea (lu′te.a. L. fem. adj. lutea orange coloured).
Gram-positive-staining, aerobic actinobacterium with branching hyphae.
Substrate mycelium is well developed and forms single or clustered spores.
Good growth occurs on yeast extract-malt extract agar, potato agar, oatmeal agar, glycerol-asparagine agar and inorganic salts-starch agar; moderate growth occurs on Czapek's agar and nutrient agar.
The colour of the substrate mycelium is yellow to orange.
Nitrate reduction is positive and H2S and melanin production, gelatin liquefaction, milk coagulation and peptonization are negative.

l-Arabinose, dulcitol, d-fructose, d-galactose, d-glucose, glycerol, lactose, maltose, melibiose, d-ribose, sucrose and d-xylose are utilized as sole carbon and energy sources, but not myo-inositol, d-mannose, d-mannitol, melezitose, raffinose, l-rhamnose, salicin, d-sorbitol, l-sorbose or trehalose.
l-Arginine, l-aspartic acid, l-histidine and l-serine are used as sole nitrogen sources, but not l-alanine, l-glutamic acid, l-methionine, l-phenylalanine or l-valine.
Starch is degraded, but adenine, aesculin, cellulose, chitin, glucosamine, hypoxanthine, urea and xanthine are not degraded.
Grows at 20–45 °C, pH 6.0–8.0 and 0–7 % (w/v) NaCl, with optimal growth at 28 °C, pH 7.0 and 1 % (w/v) NaCl.
The peptidoglycan type is A1γ and the major whole-cell sugars are glucose and xylose.
The phospholipids are diphosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylethanolamine, phosphatidylinositol, phosphatidylinositol mannosides and some unknown phospholipids.
The major cellular fatty acids (>10 %) are iso-C16 : 0 and iso-C15 : 0.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 69.3 mol%.
The type strain is YIM 013T (=CCTCC AA207012T =KCTC 19195T), isolated from sediment from Shenzhen Futian Mangrove and Birds Nature Reserve in Guangdong Province, southern China.
